intro: Ossaea angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved ossaea, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its slender, grass-like leaves and clusters of small, white or pale green flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to cold, arid environments. Its flowering period occurs in late spring to early summer, and it plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
